result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott Vukovic was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary (Home Invasion), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA surcharge, all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges.  All to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing  is to convert to a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with cases  15CF1150 and  15CF1157.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.  Complete a job training program to enhance ability to obtain employment.
Cooperate and participate with a mental health evaluation. Follow any recommended treatment.
Comply with the standard rules of Extended Supervision.
Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment. Follow any recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit to random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, pay surcharge.
Defendant advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms; he is unable to vote in any election  until civil rights are restored.  Further advised that if  he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.

charges.descr: Attempt Robbery with Use of Force

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott Vukovic

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: SENTENCING HEARING Transcript commencing 07/21/2015 received and filed.  Original transcript in case file 15CF001157 (33 Pages).  CH

Defendant Scott Vukovic in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Scott Vukovic in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense and defendant. Additional statements made by the victim, Ruth G., and her daughter.

AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 15 YEARS, concurrent to case# 15CF1150, and concurrent to case# 15CF1157.
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 10 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 5 YEARS.
Credit given for 171 days time served.

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNT 1):  
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* No contact with the victims.
* Seek and maintain full-time employment.
* Complete a job training program to enhance ability to obtain employment.
* Cooperate and participate with a mental health evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered that the court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* As to case# 15CF1157:  PAY restitution in the amount of $350.00 payable to the victim, June or Nathan B.  The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* As to case# 15CF1150:  PAY restitution in the amount of $485.00 payable to the victim, Ruth G.  The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form.
filed by ADA Timothy Cotter on behalf of the State.

Defendant Scott Vukovic in court IN CUSTODY with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #2 dismissed and read-in for sentencing purposes.

Case adjourned to 07-21-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Sentencing Hearing.

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant Scott Vukovic not in court, in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a Plea and Sentencing Hearing date.
Case adjourned to 05-12-2015 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant Scott Vukovic not in court, in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a status conference date.
Case adjourned to 04-06-2015 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Status Conference.

Defendant Scott Vukovic in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Scott Vukovic in custody.  Ron Dague for Timothy Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Marlene C.

Defendant Scott Vukovic in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Scott Vukovic in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
